result.execSummary:
The defendant James Perricone Pfalz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution is payable to Pick N Save and to be paid in full by 01-20-2017 or serve 4 days Jail as penalty for failure to pay.

In lieu of payment, defendant to serve 5 days jail (CONSECUTIVE TO THE 120 DAYS, BUT CONCURRENT TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY CASE 15CF1423).
DNA sample and surcharge are waived.

records.addlTxt:
Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James Perricone Pfalz in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.



Court orders the following:
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to:  Milwaukee County Case: 15CF1423 in the State Prison System.

Restitution:  $200 (to be paid to Pick N Save - to be paid before costs/fines) 
To be paid in full by:  01/20/17
Alternate:  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail or converted to a civil judgment.

Costs:  $243  Forthwith - In Lieu of Payment 5 days jail consecutive to the 120 days but concurrent to Milwaukee County Case: 15CF1423.
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waived - Defendant currently in the State Prison System.
